lesson.title_and_level: Intermediate - Pop Music and Pop Culture

sentence.idiomatic: Elders like to read.
Does middle age people like to play cards?
What does the teenagers like?
Children doesn't like to go to school.
Classical music
Rock music
Jazz music
Ms. Li wants to listen to pop music, for example Pang Long's music.
You can contact me, for example give me a call.
I like to eat fruits, for example apples.
What is the hottest song?
Is he the most unpopular employee?
Is that the most popular TV show of this year?
I like to eat meat in the past.
Were you really fat in the past?
Ms. Li was a secretary in the past.
Is the Eastern music popular in America?
Western food is very popular in China.
Where is the popular place for westerners.
I'm fine now.
Is Ms. Li a teacher now? Yes.
Where are you right now? I'm in Shanghai.

word.literal: to kill time in a bar

sentence.idiomatic: I hardly to go bars.
Where does he usually go? He often goes to Disco hall.
Does Mr. Wang often watch movies? Not often.
Mrs. Wang is taking a rest at the hotel.
Are we eating at the restaurant?
Mr. Li likes to sing at Karaoke.
This is nothing new.
Is this new thing?
You guys don't want to go to the bar?
Are you willing to cook?
Why is Ms. Wang not willing to sing?
I'm used to staying home on the weekends.
Are you used to the music here?
Mr. Wang is not used to dancing in karaoke.
You should social more with others.
Ms. Li doesn't like to social with others.
Do you often social with others in a bar?

Young people in China like to listen to pop music. For example, this year the most popular singer is Pang Long. In the past western pop music was very popular in China. Now Japanese and Korean pop music is very hot too.

word.literal: to kill time in a bar

sentence.idiomatic: Now young people often go bar hopping. They can dance in discos, and listen to music and chat with friends in bars. This is a new thing in China. In the past young people weren’t willing to go to bars. Now they are used to socializing in bars.

word.literal: to kill time in a bar
a list of names arranged according to seniority or place in a competition
